thread.title: Malcolm Mitchell 'ready to move forward' with another book
thread.title_full: Malcolm Mitchell 'ready to move forward' with another book

title: Malcolm Mitchell 'ready to move forward' with another book
text:
Manage Malcolm Mitchell 'ready to move forward' with another book Former Georgia standout Malcolm Mitchell is a Super Bowl winner and self-published author but he's ready to do more.   
Malcolm Mitchell is ready. No, that’s not in reference to football where he won a Super Bowl with New England and caught six passes for 70 yards. 
Mitchell is ready to continue his off-field pursuits as an author. After self publishing ‘The Magician’s Hat’ while at Georgia, he already has his second project in mind. 
“I do have one and I’m ready to move forward,” Mitchell told NFL Network over the weekend, “because I feel like reading can definitely help kids and people reach their full potential.” (Photo: UGA Athletics) Not a member? Try a seven-day FREE trial to VIP access to Dawgs247! 
But there’s a hurdle to clear first. While Mitchell’s first book has become quite popular because of his status as a professional athlete and the story of his inspiring journey from a middle-school literacy level when he first arrived at UGA to avid reader, there’s still more work to be done. 
The Valdosta High School product is still trying to get “The Magician’s Hat” picked up by a publishing company. Accomplishing that might result in bigger and better things for him as an author. 
“I would love to get the message to a broader scope just to share the magic of reading and the personal experience I had with it,” Mitchell said. “So right now I’m trying to work with a publisher to get ‘The Magician’s Hat’ out even more and hopefully they’ll work with me on a second book.” 
(What's next for the Bulldogs? Make sure you're in the loop -- take a few moments to sign up for our FREE Bulldogs Newsletter! ) Author
